data.event: For several centuries, Motala remained a small village, mainly regarded as a stopping post on the road to the nearby town of Vadstena, one of cultural centres of medieval Sweden.

event.title: built at Motala and later Queen Kristina had a summer

data.event: However, King Gustav Vasa had a manor house built at Motala and later Queen Kristina had a summer residence built at the spa resort of Medevi, 20 km north of the town.

event.title: 1823, while full city rights were granted

data.event: The town received the minor privilege status of k√∂ping in 1823, while full city rights were granted as of April 1, 1881.
With the Swedish municipal reform of 1971, Motala became the seat of Motala Municipality.
